meanings.definition: Not having trust or confidence in someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She felt untrusting towards the new student in class.
meanings.sent2: The untrusting cat cautiously approached the unfamiliar dog.
meanings.sent3: The untrusting squirrel refused to share its acorns, suspecting a trick.
meanings.sent4: His untrusting eyes scanned the room, searching for any signs of deceit.
meanings.sent5: The untrusting nature of the detective helped him solve the case by questioning everything.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of trust or confidence.
meanings.sent1: The untrusting expression on her face revealed her doubts.
meanings.sent2: His untrusting behavior made it difficult for others to work with him.
meanings.sent3: The untrusting puppy barked at its own reflection in the mirror, unsure of the 'other' dog.
meanings.sent4: The untrusting clouds refused to part, keeping the sun hidden behind a veil of doubt.
meanings.sent5: The untrusting tone in her voice hinted at past betrayals that left deep scars.
